New Records: Teboho Mokoena scored a brace in the match.
South Africa achieved a 5-0 victory over Congo in the first leg of the 2025 AFCON qualifier.
Key Match Events: Teboho Mokoena scored the first goal from a header after a corner kick.
He followed up with a second goal with a powerful half-volley.
The match was halted in the first half due to pitch invasions by fans.
Pre-Game Insights: Bafana Bafana coach Hugo Broos emphasized the importance of not underestimating Congo despite their challenges.
The team was in high spirits and well-prepared for the match.
Post-Match Reflections: The match was memorable for the Gqeberha fans and a tough experience for the Congolese team.
Teboho Mokoena was celebrated as the Man of the Match and given a standing ovation.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match set the stage for the return leg in Congo on October 15.
Themba Zwane was set to reach his 50th cap in the upcoming match.
